Description: Painted sycomore fig wood daily life shabti of a man whose name is illegible with a black curled lappet-wig, a brown face with black details, a yellow and red collar edged with black dots, brown hands in relief holding red hoes, the body is painted white, the stomach is emphasized with a red line, the long triangular apron of the kilt is inscribed with a central column of black painted hieroglyphs on a yellow ground bordered with red lines, the back has a red seed-basket and two nu-pots hanging from a red yoke and a second empty yoke hanging down one arm.
